intro: Ambrina, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its striking blue or purple ray florets and spiny, lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and saline soils, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Ambrina produces small, cylindrical seed heads that are often used in ornamental gardening. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and resilient species within its native habitat.
